intro: Macbridea alba, commonly known as the white macbridea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. Macbridea alba is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests.
